content.prompt: A lab cart is traveling along a straight, horizontal track with an unknown initial velocity. The graph shows the net force on the cart as a function of time during a short time interval. Does the graph provide sufficient information to determine the change in momentum of the cart during the time interval shown, and what evidence supports the claim?

choices.label: Yes, because the change in momentum is equal to the area under the curve of the force-versus-time graph.
Yes, because the change in momentum is equal to the slope of the force-versus-time graph.
No, because the initial momentum is unknown and therefore the change in momentum cannot be determined.
No, because the force is not constant and therefore the change in momentum cannot be determined.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
